body_html:
/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu is not in the list of include directories returned by gcc which explains why bazel cannot find it. Weird that it found stuff there.

Anyhow, the fix for cuda should be to add the following line:

  cxx_builtin_include_directory: "/home/.slash_usr/lib/gcc/"

at that line: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/third_party/gpus/crosstool/CROSSTOOL#L62

body:
`/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu` is not in the list of include directories returned by gcc which explains why bazel cannot find it. Weird that it found stuff there.

Anyhow, the fix for cuda should be to add the following line:

```
  cxx_builtin_include_directory: "/home/.slash_usr/lib/gcc/"
```

at that line: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/third_party/gpus/crosstool/CROSSTOOL#L62
